properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 1 at 11:13PM PST until March 2 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES IN EFFECT FOR THE LOS ANGELES AND
VENTURA MOUNTAINS THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY MONDAY...

.A cold storm system will affect the Los Angeles and Ventura
County Mountains through early Monday. Snow levels are expected
to drop to as low as 2500 to 3000 feet overnight. This could
bring hazardous driving conditions to portions of the Interstate 5
Corridor and other mountain roads. Overall, snowfall totals will
average 2 to 4 inches. However, totals up to 6 inches are
possible across the eastern San Gabriel Mountains above 5000 feet.

* WHAT...Snow showers through early Monday morning. Snow levels
will be lower to between 2500 and 3000 feet overnight. Total
snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are expected. North winds
will gust as high as 40 mph Monday morning.

* WHERE...Ventura County Mountains.

* WHEN...Until 7 AM PST Monday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibility at times
in snow, blowing snow, and fog. There nay be light snow
accumulations on portions of Highway 33 overnight with very
slippery road conditions.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions from CalTrans are available by calling
1 800 4 2 7 7 6 2 3.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST MONDAY
